required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Consuming on Body Composition and Blood Biochemistry Index
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Consuming on Body Composition and Blood Biochemistry Index

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effect of consuming on body composition and blood biochemistry index

primary_outcome.measure: The change of body fat mass
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline body fat mass at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: The body fat mass (kg) was assessed by InBody770.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline triglyceride at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of Triglyceride

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline total cholesterol at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of Total cholestrol

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline HDL-cholesterol at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of HDL-cholestrol

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline LDL-cholesterol at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of LDL-cholestrol

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Fecal microbiome at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Firmicutes, Bacteroidetes, Lactobucillius, and A. muciniphila were quantified by quantitative PCR.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of body mass index (BMI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline body mass index at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: BMI is a measurement of a person's leanness or corpulence based on their height and weight, and is intended to quantify tissue mass.The body mass index (BMI, kg/m^2) and body mass (kg) were assessed by InBody770.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of body fat percentage
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline body fat percentage at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: The body fat percentage (%) was assessed by InBody770

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline visceral fat at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: The visceral fat (10 cm^2) was assessed by InBody770.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline fasting glycemia at 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of fasting glycemia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline aspartate aminotransferase at 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of aspartate aminotransferase

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline alanine aminotransferase at 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of alanine aminotransferase

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline albumin at 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of albumin

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline creatinine at 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of creatine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline uric acid at 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of uric acid

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of white blood cell
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline white blood cell at 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous blood was sampled to measure concentrations of white blood cell

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female aged between 20 and 60 years old
- Body mass index (BMI) â‰¥ 24 (kg/m^2) or body fat mass: male > 25%, female > 30%
- Prohibitions on other nutritional supplements (probiotics and prebiotics) before two weeks of the study
- Abidance by the similar diet and exercise habits over the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding woman
- Menopausal woman
- Diabetes mellitus
- Implementation in weight loss programs before a half year of this study
- Metabolic disorders
- Kidney diseases
- Liver diseases
- Cardiovascular diseases
- Nervous system diseases
- Gastrointestinal diseases
- Heavy drinking or constant drug use.

facility.name: National Pingtung University of Science and Technology
